# Firebase Structure

Whenever the user selects a sequence to execute, the server will create a document in firebase to store the status of 
all the operations, the parameters selected and all the measurements during the execution

The document structure:

```json5
{ 
  // (str) random id generated by firebase. Example -LxVpoNVlj3UhVthtbVf
  "id":  {
      "content": {
          // List of all operations of the sequence
          "actions": [
              // Each operation of the list contains the following
              {
                    // Operation name, can be retrieved from the sequence document
                    "name": "operation_name",
                    // Optional parameter of the operation, null if not used
                    "parameter": null,
                    // Updated by microcontroller when starts operation
                    "startTime": "date",
                    // Updated by microcontroller when ends operation
                    "endTime": "date",
                    // Status of operation. 0 for pending, 1 for success, 2 for failed
                    "status": 0
              },
              // ...
          ],
          // When the experiment starts, the pc will periodically stores measurements
          "measurements": {
              "temperature": [],
              "ph": [],
          }, 
          // Experiment parameters to be consumed by pc / microcontroller or tuned manually
          "parameters": {
              // (float)
              "voltage": null,
              // (int) in seconds
              "measurement_interval_s": null,
              // (int) in minutes
              "experiment_time_min": null,
              // (float) percentage of bicarbonate solution
              "bicarbonate_concentration": null
          } 
      }
  }
}
```
